definition: to lift/to pry open/to lever open

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: They prised the box open with a lever.
sentences.chinese: 他們用槓桿把箱子撬開。

sentences.english: Jobic took his bar of iron and broke open the other door.
sentences.chinese: 若比用他的鐵棒撬開了另一個門。

sentences.english: Duane opened the box with his knife.
Frank begged him to do so and the dealer reluctantly prised it open.
sentences.chinese: 經弗蘭懇求，古董商才勉強把貨箱撬開了。

sentences.english: Show any hacker a lock and his first thought is how to pick it.
sentences.chinese: 任何黑客看到一把鎖，首先想到的是怎麼才能撬開。

sentences.english: We pried open the locked door with an iron bar.
sentences.chinese: 我們用鐵棍把鎖着的門撬開。

sentences.english: He pried the box open with a screwdriver.
sentences.chinese: 他用螺絲起子把箱子撬開了。

sentences.english: The thieves forced the lock of the lady's jewel case.
sentences.chinese: 盜賊撬開了那位太太的珠寶箱上的鎖。

sentences.english: At last the door broke open.
The blacksmith picked a lock with a pin.
sentences.chinese: 工匠用大頭針把鎖撬開了。

sentences.english: He was prizing up the box with all his strength.
sentences.chinese: 他使盡力氣設法撬開箱子。

sentences.english: We managed to prise off the lid with a tyre lever.
sentences.chinese: 我們設法用卸外胎用的撬棍撬開了蓋子。

sentences.english: Prising open the lid on previous mistakes might unleash a political hornet-swarm.
sentences.chinese: 撬開先前的錯誤或許會捅開一個政治馬蜂窩。
他用一把削鉛筆刀撬開鎖。

sentences.english: With the help of our iPhone opening tool, we pop out the logic board.
sentences.chinese: 在iPhone開腔工具的幫助下，我們撬開了主板。

sentences.english: He forced the lock with a penknife.
sentences.chinese: 他用一把鉛筆刀撬開鎖。
